7.  Find  the moments  of each experience that you are doing well, good for others or moments that nice things happen. Talk about them. Write about it. Reflect. There are more ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ú®to come....
6. Try something new every single day. And honor an ongoing habit everyday. Just because. Your identity is both your past and current choices. Changing and yet stable.

5. Cheer for yourself when nobody sees the progress you have fought for or contribution you have added. It's not their opinion that matters the most. Your self-reflection will be transformative and enduring, more than any fleeting, external approval.

4. Be brave. Be honest. Take responsibility and allow others to work on their own stuff.  See your scary growth areas and keep on growing/going for it. For some, doing things together is more challenging. For others, doing it alone is the tougher challenge.

3. Bite-sized action. Don't save the world today. Identify a Now item that leads to a better tomorrow. Moving the ball just one bit is getting you closer to your end. Be realistic. Is it a sprint or a marathon? Don't force the timing.
2. Give off good vibes and draw them out in a neutral environment. Nurture and cherish your support network. Spreading aloha is good for your spirit!

‚ö°Ô∏èA few things that might ease the days ahead. 

1.  Stay hydrated and get enough sleep. Water for car. For lunch. For afterschool. For in between. Flavorful options are good but water is one of the greatest free üéÅ to our well-being. Take care of physical health.
